data.title: Louisiana Christian University Ranking & Overview 2024
data.meta_description: 2024 Louisiana Christian University ranking & overview including study areas, degrees, programs & courses, tuition, admission, acceptance rate, accreditation & more.
data.text:
Founded in 1906, the Louisiana Christian University is a non-profit private higher education institution located in the suburban setting of the large town of Pineville (population range of 10,000-49,999 inhabitants), Louisiana. Officially accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges, Louisiana Christian University (LCU) is a very small-sized (uniRank enrollment range: 1,000-1,999 students) coeducational US higher education institution formally affiliated with the Christian-Baptist religion. Louisiana Christian University (LCU) offers courses and programs leading to officially recognized higher education degrees such as pre-bachelor's degrees (i.e. certificates, diplomas, associate or foundation), bachelor's degrees and master's degrees in several areas of study. See the uniRank degree levels and areas of study table below for further details. This 117-year-old US higher-education institution has a selective admission policy based on entrance examinations and students' past academic records and grades. The acceptance rate range is 70-79% making this US higher education organization a moderately selective institution. International students are welcome to apply for enrollment. LCU also provides several academic and non-academic facilities and services to students including a library, housing, sports facilities, financial aids and/or scholarships, study abroad and exchange programs, online courses and distance learning opportunities, as well as administrative services.

Gender Admission

This institution admits Men and Women (coed).

Admission Selection

Has Louisiana Christian University a selective admission policy? Yes, based on entrance examinations and students' past academic records and grades.

Admission Rate

Louisiana Christian University's acceptance rate range is 70-79% making this institution a moderately selective higher education institution.

Admission Requirements

Secondary school GPA is required

Secondary school rank is neither required nor recommended

Secondary school record is required

Completion of college-preparatory program is recommended

Recommendations are neither required nor recommended

Formal demonstration of competencies is neither required nor recommended

Admission test scores are required

TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) is required

Other Test (Wonderlic, WISC-III, etc.) is neither required nor recommended

Source: IPDES

International Students Admission

International students are welcome to apply for admission at this institution.

Louisiana Christian University international students information:

In Fall 2022, the university had 47 international students from 17 countries.

More information at https://lcuniversity.edu/admissions/international-students/

Admission Office

University Library

This institution has a physical Library.

Louisiana Christian University's library does not have any external branch. The library collection is comprised of both physical (i.e. books, medium, etc.) and digital/electronic items. In 2023 the library reported 88,027 physical volumes, 920 physical media, 510 digital/electronic media, and 139 licensed digital/electronic databases. Louisiana Christian University's library has a total library expenditure greater than $150,000 per year.

University Housing

This institution provides housing services such as on-campus residences or dormitories.

In particular, the Louisiana College provides on-campus housing and the total dormitory capacity, whether on or off campus, was about 700 students in the 2021 academic year. Source: IPDES.

Sport Facilities/Activities

This institution features sporting facilities and organizes sports activities for its students.

Louisiana Christian University offers a wide range of sports and recreational facilities to cater to the interests and physical well-being of its students. The sports included in the National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics (NAIA) at the university are:

Football

Soccer

Basketball

Baseball

Tennis

Softball

Golf

Volleyball

Cheerleading

These sports provide students with various opportunities to participate in competitive games, represent the university in intercollegiate competitions, and foster a sense of teamwork and sportsmanship.

The university also offers several well-equipped facilities to support students' physical activities and fitness goals:

Outdoor basketball court: An outdoor court where students can enjoy playing basketball and engage in friendly games.

Sand volleyball court: A designated area for playing beach volleyball, providing a fun and recreational environment for students.

Tennis court: A court for students interested in playing tennis, whether for leisure or competitive purposes.

Athletic club: The athletic club offers an array of facilities, including a gym, indoor swimming pool, hot tub, sauna, indoor basketball, racquetball, and pickleball courts. This comprehensive facility allows students to engage in a variety of physical activities and workouts.

Fitness trail: A designated trail or path designed for walking, jogging, or running, providing an outdoor fitness option for students to stay active.

Disc golf course: A specialized course for playing disc golf, offering a unique and enjoyable recreational activity for students.

Additionally, Louisiana Christian University promotes a sense of community and healthy competition among students through intramural sports and tournaments conducted throughout the school year.

Financial Aid

This institution offers one or more of the following financial aid for eligible students: scholarships, grants, loans, tuition waivers, emergency financial aid etc.

Louisiana Christian University offers the following financial aids:

Federal Financial Aid

State of Louisiana Financial Aid, which includes:

Louisiana Office of Student Financial Assistance

Louisiana TOPS Program

Louisiana GO Grant Policy

For more information, please visit their website at https://lcuniversity.edu/campus-life/financial-aid/

Study Abroad

This institution offers study abroad and exchange program opportunities for its students.

Distance Learning

This institution provides a distance learning mode for certain programs or courses.

In particular, this institution offers some programs fully via distance education at the undergraduate level and at the graduate level. Source: IPDES.
